Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role of President Trump in the creation of the Veterans Choice Program, suggesting that he came up with the idea and got it passed after 44 years, when in fact it was created by the bipartisan Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act signed by President Obama in 2014.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to substantiate the assertion that President Trump was solely responsible for the creation and passage of the Veterans Choice Program.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Veterans Choice Program was already launched in 2014 during the Obama administration, suggesting that it took 44 years to get the legislation passed.
Falters at times: The claim falters in accurately representing the origin and timeline of the Veterans Choice Program, as well as President Trump's involvement in its creation.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that President Trump's idea for the Veterans Choice Program was unique and groundbreaking, overlooking the bipartisan legislation that already existed.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge the alternative explanation that the Veterans Choice Program was created and passed through bipartisan efforts, rather than solely by President Trump's idea and actions.
